Dead & Company will make their return to the Sphere in Las Vegas, announcing a new slate of residency dates taking place in the spring of 2025.

The new dates, billed as “Dead Forever 2025,” follow their previous residency in which they played 30 shows at the Las Vegas venue this summer. Now, they’ve got a brand new slate of shows arriving in 2025 and coinciding with the band’s 10th anniversary.

Get Dead & Company Tickets Here

Scroll below for more details, including how to get tickets, and see the full list of Dead & Co.’s tour dates.

How Can I Buy Tickets to Dead & Company’s 2025 Residency at The Sphere?

Tickets for Dead & Company’s 2025 residency will first be available via an artist pre-sale, which is set for Tuesday, December 10th at 10:00 a.m. PST (registration is ongoing). A Live Nation pre-sale will follow on Thursday, December 12th at 10:00 a.m. PST (use code JOY) via Ticketmaster. Travel and VIP packages will also be available starting Thursday, December 5th here.

Tickets will go on-sale for the general public on Friday, December 13th at 10:00 a.m. PST via Ticketmaster.

Once tickets are on-sale, fans can look for deals or get tickets to sold-out concerts via StubHub, where orders are 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s FanProtect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand.

What Is Dead & Company’s 2025 Residency at The Sphere?

Dead & Company will be celebrating their 10th anniversary with their second run of shows at the Sphere, Las Vegas’ new hi-tech, billion-dollar venue. “Dead Forever 2025” consists of 18 shows taking place from March to May, and according to a press release, these shows will be the band’s “only Sphere shows in 2025.” The new shows will also feature updated visuals from their last residency at the venue.

The residency begins on March 20th, and continue with three-date stretches throughout March, April, and May. The residency concludes on Saturday, May 17th. See the full list of dates below.

Prior to Dead & Co.’s Sphere shows, Eagles will conclude their 2025 residency at the venue  Learn how to get tickets to their residency here.

Who Is Playing in Dead & Company?

Dead & Company’s lineup heading into their 2025 residency is comprised of former Grateful Dead members Bobby Weir and Mickey Hart along with John Mayer, Oteil Burbridge, Jeff Chimenti, and Jay Lane.

While Weir and Hart had been planning a 60th anniversary Grateful Dead reunion with fellow members Bill Kreutzmann and Phil Lesh for 2025, those plans are now in question following Lesh’s death in October.

What Can I Expect From Dead & Company’s Sphere Shows?

In addition to updated visuals, fans can expect nearly four hours of Dead & Company’s psychedelic rock and jam band ethos. The group celebrates the Grateful Dead’s 60-year legacy with numerous covers and deep cuts, with a different set every night.

What Are Dead & Company’s 2025 Tour Dates?

See Dead & Company’s full list of dates at The Sphere in Las Vegas below, and get tickets to all upcoming shows here.

There are several great hotel options within walking distance of The Sphere, including:

— The Venetian Resort – Connected to the Sphere, the Venetian offers large rooms, a remarkable canal system with gondola rides, a state-of-the-art casino, and over 40 restaurants​.

— The LINQ Hotel – The LINQ provides modern rooms with great views, multiple dining options, and easy access to the High Roller observation wheel​.

— Harrah’s – Harrah’s is located next door to the Sphere and features spacious rooms, a massive casino, and several restaurants.

— Treasure Island – The hotel features spacious rooms, multiple pools, and a casino. It’s a fun option for families and budget-conscious travelers.
